Button.description: Buttons are used to trigger actions or events
Button.usage: Use primary for main actions, secondary for less important actions, tertiary for subtle actions, danger for destructive actions, ghost for minimal emphasis
Button.accessibility: Always provide descriptive text or iconDescription for screen readers

TextInput.description: Text inputs enable users to enter free-form text data
TextInput.usage: Always include labelText for accessibility. Use helperText for additional context. Use invalidText for error states.
TextInput.accessibility: labelText is required for screen readers. Use aria-describedby for additional context.

Tile.description: Tiles are container components that group related content
Tile.usage: Use for cards, panels, containers. Clickable tiles are interactive. Selectable tiles can be toggled.
Tile.carbonImport: import { Tile, ClickableTile, SelectableTile, ExpandableTile } from '@carbon/react';

Modal.description: Modals focus user attention on a specific task or piece of information
Modal.usage: Use for confirmations, forms, or important information. Always provide a way to close.
Modal.accessibility: Focus is trapped within the modal. Escape key should close the modal.

DataTable.description: Data tables display information in a grid of rows and columns
DataTable.usage: Use for displaying tabular data. Enable sorting for comparing data. Use batch actions for multiple selections.
DataTable.accessibility: Use proper table headers and scope attributes. Provide sort state announcements.
DataTable.carbonImport: import { DataTable, Table, TableHead, TableRow, TableHeader, TableBody, TableCell } from '@carbon/react';

Dropdown.description: Dropdowns present a list of options that users can select from
Dropdown.usage: Use for selecting a single option from a list. Use inline variant for compact layouts.
Dropdown.accessibility: titleText is required for screen readers. Keyboard navigation is supported.

Checkbox.description: Checkboxes allow users to select one or more options from a list
Checkbox.usage: Use for multiple selections. Use indeterminate state for parent checkboxes with mixed children.
Checkbox.accessibility: labelText is required. Use fieldset and legend for checkbox groups.

RadioButton.description: Radio buttons allow users to select exactly one option from a set
RadioButton.usage: Use when users can only select one option. Always use within RadioButtonGroup.
RadioButton.accessibility: labelText is required. Use RadioButtonGroup for proper grouping.

Toggle.description: Toggles are used to quickly switch between two possible states
Toggle.usage: Use for on/off states. labelA is for off state, labelB is for on state.
Toggle.accessibility: labelText is required for screen readers.

Notification.description: Notifications communicate important information to users
Notification.usage: Use toast for transient messages. Use inline for contextual messages. Use actionable when user action is needed.
Notification.accessibility: Use appropriate role attribute. Provide statusIconDescription for screen readers.

Tabs.description: Tabs organize content into separate views where only one can be visible at a time
Tabs.usage: Use for organizing related content. Keep tab labels short and descriptive.
Tabs.accessibility: Keyboard navigation is supported. Use arrow keys to move between tabs.
Tabs.carbonImport: import { Tabs, TabList, Tab, TabPanels, TabPanel } from '@carbon/react';

Accordion.description: Accordions deliver large amounts of content in a small space through progressive disclosure
Accordion.usage: Use for FAQ sections or when space is limited. Only one item should be open at a time in most cases.
Accordion.accessibility: Keyboard navigation is supported. Use Enter or Space to toggle.

Tag.description: Tags are used for items that need to be labeled, categorized, or organized
Tag.usage: Use for categorization, filtering, or status indicators. Use filter variant for filtering UI.

Search.description: Search enables users to specify a word or phrase to find relevant content
Search.usage: Use for filtering content or finding information. Provide clear placeholder text.
Search.accessibility: labelText is required for screen readers even if visually hidden.

Loading.description: Loading spinners indicate that a page or component is loading
Loading.usage: Use for async operations. Use overlay variant for full-page loading. Use small variant for inline loading.
Loading.accessibility: description is required for screen readers.

Form.description: Forms are used to collect user input
Form.usage: Use for data entry. Group related fields. Provide clear labels and validation feedback.
Form.accessibility: Use proper label associations. Provide error messages for invalid fields.

Grid.description: Grid provides a responsive layout system
Grid.usage: Use for page layout. Grid has 16 columns on large screens, 8 on medium, 4 on small.

Link.description: Links are used for navigation or triggering actions
Link.usage: Use for navigation between pages or sections. Use inline variant within text.
Link.accessibility: Link text should be descriptive. Avoid 'click here' or 'read more'.

Breadcrumb.description: Breadcrumbs show users their current location relative to the information architecture
Breadcrumb.usage: Use for multi-level navigation. Current page should not be a link.

ProgressIndicator.description: Progress indicators guide users through multi-step processes
ProgressIndicator.usage: Use for multi-step workflows. Keep step labels short and descriptive.
ProgressIndicator.accessibility: Current step is announced to screen readers.
